commit_message:
Make tempest L3 capable plugin aware

With this patch, the public network config in tempest.conf will be
done for the plugins that support L3.

This is required to enable third-party CI for stable/havana

Conflicts:

	lib/neutron
	lib/tempest

Change-Id: I820fe300fac45ff92d1281ff0c43ebc137783210
(cherry picked from commit afbc631cb8c89316bbecbf0f2c601103304e1994)

commit_message:
Don't delete trust on backup stack delete

Since the trust_id is copied from the stack being backed-up, we
don't want to delete the trust when the backup is deleted, or
the actual stack will break when the next deferred auth operation
occurs.

Closes-Bug: #1271968
Change-Id: I2b971fad7e010469cbb8a9c9ed326d89e92f2197
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/68/68668/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_delete_trust_backup(self): cfg.CONF.set_override('deferred_auth_method', 'trusts') class FakeKeystoneClientFail(FakeKeystoneClient): def delete_trust(self, trust_id): raise Exception("Shouldn't delete") self.m.StubOutWithMock(clients.OpenStackClients, 'keystone') clients.OpenStackClients.keystone().MultipleTimes().AndReturn( FakeKeystoneClientFail()) self.m.ReplayAll() self.stack = parser.Stack( self.ctx, 'delete_trust', template.Template({})) stack_id = self.stack.store() db_s = db_api.stack_get(self.ctx, stack_id) self.assertIsNotNone(db_s) self.stack.delete(backup=True) db_s = db_api.stack_get(self.ctx, stack_id) self.assertIsNone(db_s) self.assertEqual(self.stack.state, (parser.Stack.DELETE, parser.Stack.COMPLETE)) @utils.stack_delete_after

commit_message:
Remove X-Storage-Stoken from object_storage

We don't need it since X-Auth-Token is the one used and if defined as
None would crash.

Change-Id: I9487838996c861d99915132c4cb491fb66460593
Closes-Bug: 1266876

commit_message:
text-html type is absent in TXT_ENC

If we get response with 404 status code and this response
contains in headers "content-type: text/html", NotFound
exception isn't raised.
Add 'text/html' type of content and convert value of
this parameter to lower case.

Change-Id: I632701f43219fa6c0efc6e95bf6007cb0a3ff0c2
Closes-Bug: #1269712

commit_message:
Add delete specific status server test

Add test to delete a error status server.
Add test to delete a shutoff status server.
Add test to delete a paused status server.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/53/65853/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_delete_server_while_in_error_state(self): # Delete a server while it's VM state is error resp, server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='Active') resp, server = self.client.reset_state(server['id'], state='error') self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) # Verify server's state resp, server = self.client.get_server(server['id']) self.assertEqual(server['status'], 'ERROR') resp, _ = self.client.delete_server(server['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_termination(server['id']) @attr(type='gate')

subject: Delete volume transfer in volume_destroy function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 11:25:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/43b87e96e000acac2e2407c8ded1817c493be9dd', 'message': "Delete volume transfer in volume_dstroy function

Doing volume force delete operation on volume-A will change volume-A's
status to 'deleted', so all related data about volume-A should be deleted.
Now current version's volume_destroy function doesn't delete related data
of volume transfer. If there is volume transfer about volume-A, first do
force delete operation on volume A, and thus the volume-A's transfer data
would be residual. So remove the related data of volume transfer in
volume_destroy function.

commit_message:
Delete volume transfer in volume_destroy function

Doing volume force delete operation on volume-A will change volume-A's
status to 'deleted', so all related data about volume-A should be deleted.
Now current version's volume_destroy function doesn't delete related data
of volume transfer. If there is volume transfer about volume-A, first do
force delete operation on volume A, and thus the volume-A's transfer data
would be residual. So remove the related data of volume transfer in
volume_destroy function.

Change-Id: Id80a6e0cc061fccb02af60706244be043abdd72d
Closes-Bug: #1270785

commit_message:
disable/enable a service has no output

When disable/enable a cinder service, there is no output, this
caused end user does not know if the service was disabled/enabled
successfully.

It is better add some output for the command just like nova to tell
end user the service status.

Change-Id: I9d440ab7437c268b17627e255f152db0b3bf4f53
Closes-Bug: #1261120

commit_message:
Sync gettextutils from Oslo

Update gettextutils as a dependency for RPC updates

Requires changes within Cinder as well for
"get_localized_message" -> "translate" method rename.

221c37d Allow the Message class to have non-English default locales
0e1af5b Implementation of translation log handler
f5686b1 Merge "Translation Message improvements"
8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
2cfc1a7 Translation Message improvements
45658e2 Fix violations of H302:import only modules
12bcdb7 Remove vim header

commit_message:
NFS/GlusterFS: Skip incorrectly formatted shares

Shares should always be of the form address:/volume.  If they are
not (i.e., are missing the '/'), then skip them and issue a warning
message.  This will prevent us from sending incorrect connection_info
dicts to Nova.

Closes-Bug: #1267253

Change-Id: Ic40cd0cdc862b44b0a7d3e5b1d7c4fee8ea1b28d
(cherry picked from commit 21ebf2898e2f5fc8127b7a3bdc9743c49933f952)

commit_message:
Fixed inconsistency in iqn

Brick's TargetAdmin classes have a
default value set in __init__ for
iscsi_target_prefix.   The unit test was changing
the value returned for the internal _get_target,
but wasn't changing the CONF.iscsi_target_prefix to
match.  So the default value in the __init__ was
being used and hence the differences.

This patch sets the configuration's iscsi_target_prefix
which alters the values passed into the driver.  This
also makes the tests consistent between the iqn of the volume
at create time and delete time.

Closes-Bug: #1271249
Change-Id: Ie3308cf68adcbdff6057ea795af1299dded82e14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/23/68223/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
WIP: test if psycopg2 is related to races

pg jobs fail much more often than mysql ones. This might be caused
by eventlet patching psycopg2 calls, which leads to green thread
context switches (while mysqldb calls are blocking).

Change-Id: I621c8cde6049525a1be3102202b1b080b9f0ee45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/68577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: eventlet.monkey_patch(psycopg=False)

subject: Handle GlanceMetadataNotFound Exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-29 18:47:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3a3bcbb9c077223399859bb6ff2e625710673624', 'message': "Handle GlanceMetadataNotFound Exceptions

Change number I859bb2550267c6a5142e85ec89f1c7ff885588ac
fixed a bug where we weren't copying the bootable properties
of a volume or snapshot on create from snap or volume.

This didn't however handle the case of non-bootable volumes/snaps.

The result is that when the db call to get the image metadata raises
a NotFound exception we don't handle it and crash, causing the create
operation to fail.

This adds a try/except block around the copy volume/snap
glance_metadata get calls and ignores the exception.

Change-Id: Ibad730e7886b082d34717cd01b4ba31941e7594a
Closes-Bug: 1246004
"}]
commit_message:
Handle GlanceMetadataNotFound Exceptions

Change number I859bb2550267c6a5142e85ec89f1c7ff885588ac
fixed a bug where we weren't copying the bootable properties
of a volume or snapshot on create from snap or volume.

This didn't however handle the case of non-bootable volumes/snaps.

The result is that when the db call to get the image metadata raises
a NotFound exception we don't handle it and crash, causing the create
operation to fail.

This adds a try/except block around the copy volume/snap
glance_metadata get calls and ignores the exception.

Change-Id: Ibad730e7886b082d34717cd01b4ba31941e7594a
Closes-Bug: 1246004

commit_message:
Use constant time comparison in tempURL

Use constant time comparison when evaluating tempURL to avoid timing
attacks (CVE-2014-0006). This is the grizzly backport of the master
patch.

Fixes bug 1265665

Added testr-args option support for tox coverage

So we can check coverage for some test cases like:

  tox -e cover -- heat.tests.test_sqlalchemy_api

commit_message:
Enforce permissions in snapshots temporary dir

Live snapshots creates a temporary directory where libvirt driver
creates a new image from the instance's disk using blockRebase.
Currently this directory is created with 777 permissions making this
directory accessible by all the users in the system.

This patch changes the tempdir permissions so they have the o+x
flag set, which is what libvirt needs to be able to write in it and

Closes-Bug: #1227027
Change-Id: I767ff5247b4452821727e92b668276004fc0f84d
(cherry picked from commit 8a34fc3d48c467aa196f65eed444ccdc7c02f19f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/60550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(xqueralt): libvirt needs o+x in the temp directory os.chmod(tmpdir, 0o701)
deleted_lines: # NOTE (rmk): libvirt needs to be able to write to the # temp directory, which is owned nova. utils.execute('chmod', '777', tmpdir, run_as_root=True)

commit_message:
Use six to make dict work in Python 2 and Python 3

Dict's interface changed a lot between Python 2 and Python 3.
Use six to make dict work in them.
This is mapping:

six            Python 2        Python 3
six.iterkeys   dict.iterkeys   dict.keys
six.itervalues dict.itervalues dict.values
six.iteritems  dict.iteritems  dict.items

Part of blueprint keystone-py3kcompat

Change-Id: If41b19353f07853e39064f848ba74e9cdfd9bd14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/16/68116/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six for interface, url in six.iteritems(urls):

subject: libvirt: Fix root disk leak in live mig

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 15:12:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/69f2a1aadfc35873377f0b492b5013b5e7e74c7f', 'message': 'libvirt: Fix root disk leak in live mig

This patch makes sure that i_create_images_and_backing method of the
libvirt driver (called in several places, but most problematic one is
the call in the pre_live_migration method) creates all the files the
instance needs that are not present.

Prioir to this patch - the method would only attempt to download the
image, and if it did so with the path of the ephemeral drives, it could
expose the image to other users as an ephemeral devices. See the related
bug for more detaiis.

After this patch - we properly distinguish between image, ephemeral and
swap files, and make sure that the imagebackend does the correct thing.

Closes-bug: #1251590

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix root disk leak in live mig

This patch makes sure that i_create_images_and_backing method of the
libvirt driver (called in several places, but most problematic one is
the call in the pre_live_migration method) creates all the files the
instance needs that are not present.

Prioir to this patch - the method would only attempt to download the
image, and if it did so with the path of the ephemeral drives, it could
expose the image to other users as an ephemeral devices. See the related
bug for more detaiis.

After this patch - we properly distinguish between image, ephemeral and
swap files, and make sure that the imagebackend does the correct thing.

Closes-bug: #1251590

Co-authored-by: Loganathan Parthipan <parthipan@hp.com>

Change-Id: I78aa2f4243899db4f4941e77014a7e18e27fc63e

commit_message:
Allow delete when InstanceInfoCache entry is missing

The existing code wouldn't allow you to delete 'broken' instances that were
(for whatever reason) missing their InstanceInfoCache entry. This patch fixes
it such that those instances can be deleted.

Adds a test case to cover the new exception handling.

Closes-Bug: #1266919

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I3d566a25e340b5d5de86740141e1eaa5b3742915
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/65374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except (exception.NetworkNotFound, exception.NoMoreFixedIps, exception.InstanceInfoCacheNotFound):

commit_message:
Support preserve_ephemeral in baremetal.

We need to be able to capture the semantic intent of a rebuild with
ephemeral preservation for the baremetal helper, which means another
column in bm.modes.

Partial-Bug: #1174154
blueprint: baremetal-preserve-ephemeral
Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Icf627f38dac02b7d06ff0f1816741e5513a4fcf3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/59312/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from sqlalchemy import Column, MetaData, Boolean, Table def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine t = Table('bm_nodes', meta, autoload=True) preserve_ephemeral_col = Column('preserve_ephemeral', Boolean) t.create_column(preserve_ephemeral_col) def downgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine t = Table('bm_nodes', meta, autoload=True) t.drop_column('preserve_ephemeral')

commit_message:
Show bm deploy how to preserve ephemeral content.

This changes the baremetal deploy helper to be able to preserve the
ephemeral partition, if the deploy requests that. The next patch in
the series makes it possible to store that intent in the deploy and
connects it to the deploy() method.

Partial-Bug: #1174154
blueprint: baremetal-preserve-ephemeral
Change-Id: I6bf01e52589c5894eb043f2b57e915d52e81ebc3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/54308/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_deploy_preserve_ephemeral(self): address = '127.0.0.1' port = 3306 iqn = 'iqn.xyz' lun = 1 image_path = '/tmp/xyz/image' pxe_config_path = '/tmp/abc/pxeconfig' root_mb = 128 swap_mb = 64 ephemeral_mb = 128 dev = '/dev/fake' ephemeral_part = '/dev/fake-part1' swap_part = '/dev/fake-part2' root_part = '/dev/fake-part3' root_uuid = '12345678-1234-1234-12345678-12345678abcdef' self._deploy_mox() self.mox.StubOutWithMock(bmdh, 'mkfs_ephemeral') bmdh.get_dev(address, port, iqn, lun).AndReturn(dev) bmdh.get_image_mb(image_path).AndReturn(1) # < root_mb bmdh.discovery(address, port) bmdh.login_iscsi(address, port, iqn) bmdh.is_block_device(dev).AndReturn(True) bmdh.make_partitions(dev, root_mb, swap_mb, ephemeral_mb) bmdh.is_block_device(root_part).AndReturn(True) bmdh.is_block_device(swap_part).AndReturn(True) bmdh.dd(image_path, root_part) bmdh.mkswap(swap_part) bmdh.block_uuid(root_part).AndReturn(root_uuid) bmdh.logout_iscsi(address, port, iqn) bmdh.switch_pxe_config(pxe_config_path, root_uuid) bmdh.notify(address, 10000) self.mox.ReplayAll() bmdh.deploy(address, port, iqn, lun, image_path, pxe_config_path, root_mb, swap_mb, ephemeral_mb, True) self.mox.VerifyAll() bmdh.work_on_disk( dev, root_mb, swap_mb, ephemeral_mb, image_path, False). \

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2013-12-13 07:12:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f92d5248975fd2d1ee67e13010e6b8c5e5324e16', 'message': "WIP: Add preserve_ephemeral option to rebuild.

The preserve_ephemeral option for rebuild will preserve the content of
the ephemeral partition, making stateful golden image based
deployments possible even when clouds haven't deployed Cinder, or the
hypervisor doesn't support Cinder (e.g. BareMetal / Ironic).

To move this out of WIP we need:

===
    We'll need a V3 version of this. For V3 I think its fine to bake
    it straight into nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py
    without any extension work because the V3 API is still considered
    experimental. But we are no longer merging API changes unless the
    V3 API change is made before or at the same time as the V2 one (to
    ensure we stay in sync).

        The V2 version does need an extension created for it so
	clients of the API can tell if the preserve_ephemeral flag
	will be accepted ahead of time. So one example to look at is
	say os-block-device-mapping-v2-boot in the v2 servers.py. A
	dummy extension file is created which just exposes the
	presence of the extension in /extensions if the client queries
	it. Then testing self.ext_mgr.is_loaded you can process the
	preserve_ephemeral flag if the extension is loaded and ignore
	it if it isn't (that's more so a deployment that doesn't want
	this new feature can disable it).

	- Will need tests for the API changes. Eg
	- check that the xml still deserializers correctly
	- check that the preserve_ephemeral parameter is passed to
	  compute_api.rebuild correctly (both positive and negative
	  and missing).
	  - need api samples - see tests/integrated (again there are
	    both v2 and v3 versions. There are other examples of how
	    extensions handle this in there, but generally you just
	    need to produce another (additional) samples with
	    preserve_ephemeral enabled. Ping me if you want a hand
	    with this bit.
===

Partial-Bug: #1174154
blueprint: baremetal-preserve-ephemeral

Change-Id: Id33d5d4107f89814842a3f0b7f33690dd7e3aadc

commit_message:
Add preserve_ephemeral option to rebuild

The preserve_ephemeral option for rebuild will preserve the content of
the ephemeral partition, making stateful golden image based
deployments possible even when clouds haven't deployed Cinder, or the
hypervisor doesn't support Cinder (e.g. BareMetal / Ironic).

Partial-Bug: #1174154
blueprint: baremetal-preserve-ephemeral
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

Change-Id: Id33d5d4107f89814842a3f0b7f33690dd7e3aadc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/60285/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if node.hasAttribute("preserve_ephemeral"): rebuild["preserve_ephemeral"] = node.getAttribute( "preserve_ephemeral") 'preserve_ephemeral': 'preserve_ephemeral'

commit_message:
Adding HDFS as a possible data source type

HDFS is now an option for data source type on the data source
creation page.

Implements: blueprint epd-data-source-existing-hadoop-cluster

Change-Id: I0263d5fccba1242ab6cf931a7a36ee4f152de0b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/63/67563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <script type="text/javascript"> addHorizonLoadEvent(function () { horizon.modals.addModalInitFunction(function (modal) { $("#id_data_source_type").change(function() { var label = $("#id_data_source_url_label"); var username = $("#id_data_source_credential_user").closest(".control-group"); var password = $("#id_data_source_credential_pass").closest(".control-group") switch($(this).val()) { case "hdfs": label.html("hdfs://"); username.hide(); password.hide(); break; case "swift": username.show(); password.show(); label.html("swift://"); break; } }); $("#id_data_source_type").change(); }); }); </script>

commit_message:
Remove get_vif_by_mac_address from network rpcapi

This method is no longer used.  It was added to network.api and runs on
the API side now instead.  We can remove it from the rpc client code.
We can later remove it from the manager side when we do a major version
bump of this rpc API.

Change-Id: I8933bcc022558a9befed7478047422959fa47f1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/66951/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove unused method from network rpcapi

Remove get_vifs_by_instance from the nova network rpcapi.  It's unused,
so we can go ahead and remove the client side of this.  The server
(manager) side can be removed on a major rpc api version bump.

Change-Id: Iab90e87e7a82abcf290c2fc799001cc4ee8299b2

xml:id="troveclient_commands"> <!-- This file is automatically generated, do not edit --> <?dbhtml stop-chunking?> <title>trove commands</title> <para>The trove client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the OpenStack Database API and its extensions.</para> <para>For help on a specific <command>trove</command> command, enter: </para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput><command>trove</command> <option>help</option> <replaceable>COMMAND</replaceable></userinput></screen> <section xml:id="troveclient_command_usage"> <title>trove usage</title> <screen><computeroutput> [--os-password <auth-password>] [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>] [--os-tenant-id <auth-tenant-id>] [--os-auth-url <auth-url>] [--os-region-name <region-name>] [--service-type <service-type>] [--service-name <service-name>] [--bypass-url <bypass-url>] [--database-service-name <database-service-name>] [--endpoint-type <endpoint-type>] [--os-database-api-version <database-api-ver>] [--os-cacert <ca-certificate>] [--retries <retries>] [--json] <subcommand> ...</computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_command_pos"> <title>trove positional arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput> <subcommand> backup-create Creates a backup. backup-delete Deletes a backup. backup-list List available backups. backup-list-instance List available backups for an instance. backup-show Show details of a backup. create Creates a new instance. database-create Creates a database on an instance. database-delete Deletes a database. database-list Lists available databases on an instance. datastore-list List available datastores. datastore-show Show details of a datastore. datastore-version-list List available versions for a datastore. datastore-version-show Show details of a datastore version. delete Deletes an instance. flavor-list Lists available flavors. flavor-show Show details of a flavor. limit-list Lists the limits for a tenant. list List all the instances. resize-flavor Resizes the flavor of an instance. resize-volume Resizes the volume size of an instance. restart Restarts the instance. root-enable Enables root for a instance. root-show Gets root enabled status for a instance. secgroup-add-rule Creates a security group rule. secgroup-delete-rule Deletes a security group rule. secgroup-list Lists all security groups. secgroup-show Shows details about a security group. show Show details of an instance. user-create Creates a user. user-delete Deletes a user from the instance. user-grant-access Grants access to a database(s) for a user. user-list Lists the users for a instance. user-revoke-access Revokes access to a database for a user. user-show Gets a user from the instance. user-show-access Gets a users access from the instance. user-update-attributes Updates a users attributes from the instance. bash-completion Print arguments for bash_completion. help Display help about this program or one of its subcommands. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_command_optional"> <title>trove optional arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput> --version show program's version number and exit --debug Print debugging output --os-username <auth-user-name> Defaults to env[OS_USERNAME]. --os-password <auth-password> Defaults to env[OS_PASSWORD]. --os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name> Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_NAME]. --os-tenant-id <auth-tenant-id> Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_ID]. --os-auth-url <auth-url> Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_URL]. --os-region-name <region-name> Defaults to env[OS_REGION_NAME]. --service-type <service-type> Defaults to database for most actions --service-name <service-name> Defaults to env[TROVE_SERVICE_NAME] --bypass-url <bypass-url> Defaults to env[TROVE_BYPASS_URL] --database-service-name <database-service-name> Defaults to env[TROVE_DATABASE_SERVICE_NAME] --endpoint-type <endpoint-type> Defaults to env[TROVE_ENDPOINT_TYPE] or publicURL. --os-database-api-version <database-api-ver> Accepts 1,defaults to env[OS_DATABASE_API_VERSION]. --os-cacert <ca-certificate> Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying a TLS (https) server certificate. Defaults to env[OS_CACERT] --retries <retries> Number of retries. --json, --os-json-output Output json instead of prettyprint. Defaults to OS_JSON_OUTPUT </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-create"> <title>trove backup-create command</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-create [--description <description>] <name> <instance> Creates a backup. Positional arguments: <name> Name of the backup. <instance> UUID of the instance. Optional arguments: --description <description> An optional description for the backup. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-delete"> <title>trove backup-delete command</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-delete <backup> Deletes a backup. Positional arguments: <backup> ID of the backup. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-list"> <title>trove backup-list command</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-list [--limit <limit>] List available backups. Optional arguments: --limit <limit> Return up to N number of the most recent backups. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-list-instance"> <title>trove backup-list-instance command</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-list-instance [--limit <limit>] <instance> List available backups for an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> ID of the instance. Optional arguments: --limit <limit> Return up to N number of the most recent backups. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-show"> <title>trove backup-show command</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-show <backup> Show details of a backup. Positional arguments: <backup> ID of the backup. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_create"> <title>trove create command</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove create <name> <flavor_id> [--size <size>] [--databases <databases> [<databases> ...]] [--users <users> [<users> ...]] [--backup <backup>] [--availability_zone <availability_zone>] [--datastore <datastore>] [--datastore_version <datastore_version>] Creates a new instance. Positional arguments: <name> Name of the instance <flavor_id> Flavor of the instance Optional arguments: --size <size> Size of the instance disk in GB --databases <databases> [<databases> ...] Optional list of databases. --users <users> [<users> ...] Optional list of users in the form user:password. --backup <backup> A backup UUID --availability_zone <availability_zone> The Zone hint to give to nova --datastore <datastore> A datastore name or UUID --datastore_version <datastore_version> A datastore version name or UUID </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_database-create"> <title>trove database-create command</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove database-create <instance> <name> [--character_set <character_set>] [--collate <collate>] Creates a database on an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> UUID of the instance. <database> Name of the database. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_database-list"> <title>trove database-list command</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove database-list <instance> Lists available databases on an instance. git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/98/69098/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>OpenStack Networking provides users real self services of network resources and configurations. It is important that Cloud Architects and Operators evaluate their design use cases in providing users the ability to create, update, and destroy available network resources.</para> <para>If your deployment of OpenStack provides multiple external access points into different security domains it is important that you limit the tenant's ability to attach multiple vNICs to multiple external access points -- this would bridge these security domains and could lead to unforeseen security compromise. It is possible mitigate this risk by utilizing the host aggregates functionality provided by OpenStack Compute or through splitting the tenant VMs into multiple tenant projects with different virtual network configurations.</para>
deleted_lines: <para>OpenStack Networking provides users real self services of network resources and configurations. It is important that Cloud Architects and Operators evaluate the their design use cases in providing users the ability to create, update, and destroy available network resources.</para> <para>If your deployment of OpenStack provides multiple external access points into different security domains it is important that you limit the tenant's ability to attach multiple vNICs to multiple external access points -- this would bridge these security domains and could lead to unforseen security compromise. It is possible mitigate this risk by utilizing the host aggregates functionality provided by OpenStack Compute or through splitting the tenant VMs into multiple tenant projects with different virtual network configurations.</para>

added_lines: <para>Within the framework of OpenStack you can choose from any number of hypervisor platforms and corresponding OpenStack plugins to optimize your cloud environment. In the context of the OpenStack Security guide, we will be highlighting hypervisor selection considerations as they pertain to feature sets that are critical to security. However, these considerations are not meant to be an exhaustive investigation into the pros and cons of particular hypervisors. NIST provides additional guidance in Special Publication 800-125, "<emphasis>Guide to Security for Full Virtualization Technologies</emphasis>".</para>

commit_message:
Fix v2 token user ref with trust impersonation=True

The v2 token controller incorrectly checks for a string instead
of a boolean, which results in the wrong user ID (trustee, when
it should be the trustor) when impersonation=True.  So fix the
comparison and tests, adding a test which illustrates the issue.

This patchset also closes the gap that allows EC2 credentials to
be issued from trust-scoped tokens, allowing privilege escalation
since EC2 tokens have no concept of trust-scoping/role
restrictions in the Grizzly release.

Change-Id: Ic94f30f2354c9fda20531bb598387368fde8a096
Closes-Bug: #1239303
Related-Bug: #1242597

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-19 21:58:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/wsgi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/eb917b8ca016c3d88aa22da2b358c8c506857043', 'message': "disable debug in eventlet.wsgi server

the debug flag basically just means that we get lines like:

 ....wsgi.server [-] (6966) accepted ('127.0.0.1', 51944)

After *every single* wsgi request, filling up the logs with
completely irrelevant data at info level because eventlet.wsgi
does not use python logging.

Change-Id: I508b963a0c84e17df845aad260dd8ee157abbea8
"}]
commit_message:
disable debug in eventlet.wsgi server

the debug flag basically just means that we get lines like:

 ....wsgi.server [-] (6966) accepted ('127.0.0.1', 51944)

After *every single* wsgi request, filling up the logs with
completely irrelevant data at info level because eventlet.wsgi
does not use python logging.

Change-Id: I508b963a0c84e17df845aad260dd8ee157abbea8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/67732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'log_format': CONF.wsgi_log_format, 'debug': False

subject: Assign X-Auth-Url header in a separate middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-10 01:18:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/a50ed300cbb292da4c3219301268502afb79236c', 'message': "Remove X-Auth-Url header from authtoken middleware

authtoken middleware's current purpose is to set X-Auth-Url header to a
value read from heat.conf.

Since this value is not really related to anything the keystone
middleware does and is instead read from a config file, it makes sense
to move it from the authtoken middleware into the context middleware

With this change, it makes it possible to authenticate against keystone
prior to reaching heat, forward the auth headers, and still have all the
necessary information on the context.

Closes-Bug: #1259364
Change-Id: Ieb251c18aa091391a28a90c495b61cf41436f8b9

"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2014-01-14 23:24:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/aced5485a1bf28d72b984ba2f519f512d93bec7c', 'message': "Assign X-Auth-Url header in a separate middleware

authtoken middleware's current purpose is to set X-Auth-Url header to a
value read from heat.conf.

Since this value is not really related to anything the keystone
middleware does and is instead read from a config file, it makes sense
to move it from the authtoken middleware into its own middleware

This change is the first step to grouping all X-Auth-Url related logic
into one single middleware as opposed to have it scattered (or possibly
repeated) in auth_token and auth_password. For example, auth_password
also has some logic around it related to multi-cloud.  When auth_token
is updated to support multi-cloud, this logic can be extracted into the
auth_url middleware rather than duplicating it across both the
auth_token and auth_password middleware.

Also, by extracting the X-Auth-Url logic, it allows cloud
providers to remove auth_token or auth_password without side-effects.

Closes-Bug: #1259364
Change-Id: Ieb251c18aa091391a28a90c495b61cf41436f8b9
"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2014-01-15 18:57:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/437e6cd1465056134ad5ee23a5bfca7f71004299', 'message': "Assign X-Auth-Url header in a separate middleware

Since this value is not really related to anything the keystone
middleware does and is instead read from a config file, it makes sense
to move it from the authtoken middleware into its own middleware

This change is the first step to grouping all X-Auth-Url related logic
into one single middleware as opposed to have it scattered (or possibly
repeated) in auth_token and auth_password. For example, auth_password
also has some logic around it related to multi-cloud, which can be
extracted and moved to auth_url middleware in a later patch, so that all
handling of X-Auth-Url occurs in one place.

Also, by extracting the X-Auth-Url logic, it allows cloud
providers to remove auth_token or auth_password without side-effects.

Closes-Bug: #1259364

commit_message:
Assign X-Auth-Url header in a separate middleware

authtoken middleware's current purpose is to set X-Auth-Url header to a
value read from heat.conf.

Since this value is not really related to anything the keystone
middleware does and is instead read from a config file, it makes sense
to move it from the authtoken middleware into its own middleware

This change is the first step to grouping all X-Auth-Url related logic
into one single middleware as opposed to have it scattered (or possibly
repeated) in auth_token and auth_password. For example, auth_password
also has some logic around it related to multi-cloud, which can be
extracted and moved to auth_url middleware in a later patch, so that all
handling of X-Auth-Url occurs in one place.

Also, by extracting the X-Auth-Url logic, it allows cloud
providers to remove auth_token or auth_password without side-effects.

Closes-Bug: #1259364
Change-Id: Ieb251c18aa091391a28a90c495b61cf41436f8b9

as the cat ones used to read the fifo.

commit_message:
Move fake_network config option to linux_net

Option 'fake_network' is used by nova/network/linux_net.py but not
imported from nova/network/manager.py. Both use it, but manager imports
linux_net (via nova/network/api.py + nova/network/floating_ips.py) so it
makes more sense to define the option in linux_net and import_opt in
manager.

Precise example import chain:
    bin/nova-manage
    nova/cmd/manage.py: import_opt('flat_network_bridge', 'nova.network.manager')
    nova/network/manager.py: from nova.network import api as network_api
      -- At this point, manager has started to import but not yet called
      register_opts
    nova/network/api.py: from nova.network import floating_ips
    nova/nova/network/floating_ips.py: import_opt('public_interface', 'nova.network.linux_net')
    nova/nova/network/linux_net.py: import_opt('fake_network', 'nova.network.manager')
      -- BANG! Manager hasn't registered the option we want to import

Change-Id: I66f021b34aef650dca148a58203c249f6aa0e83e

commit_message:
Change meter_id to meter_name in generated docs

All operations on API level use meter name.
GET or POST /v2/meters/name_of_meter.
In docs we have meter_id, it is confusing, because meter_id is
syntetic UUID that is not used in DB ops.

The change should be done in v2.py because docs are generated
automatically and it's content is based on variables names from
the code.

Change-Id: I29abbefdaaa039f790f78fac102ede933d61d911

commit_message:
XenAPI: get_info was very expensive

Getting the whole VM record is expensive and slowed down Tempest tests
significantly.  Replaced with getting each required item.

When getting power state, only need that specific value, so reduce the
calls to get_info too.

Change-Id: I93bcef5b692a531aac41518dc29d5d4f46cded65

deleted_lines: state = self.get_info(instance, vm_ref)['state'] vm_rec = self._session.call_xenapi("VM.get_record", rescue_vm_ref) state = vm_utils.compile_info(vm_rec)['state'] vm_rec = self._session.call_xenapi("VM.get_record", vm_ref) return vm_utils.compile_info(vm_rec)

subject: Fixed OS::Neutron::Pool creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 08:58:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c2e90adcdba20a8029604aabda52e794ddffc5a9', 'message': 'Fixed OS::Neutron::Pool creation

Resource OS::Neutron::Pool could not be created when
session_persistence.type was set HTTP_COOKIE or SOURCE_IP
due to issues with sending None values to Neutron for
not filled in properties.

Change-Id: Iafb082f69bf1dd7a4f49151f65d5a1b8c69f1337
Closes-bug: #1270750
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-23 09:39:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c0d590a2eeaf3609307702f856edc005ae25884e', 'message': "Fixed OS::Neutron::Pool creation

Resource OS::Neutron::Pool could not be created when
cookie_name param for session_persistence is not set.

By default params that is not set filled with None
as value and passed to the client. This is incorrent
behaviour in Neutron case. Neutron require that all
fields that is not set should not be passed at all.

So we need to fillter out cookie_name param if it's
value set to None.

commit_message:
Fixed OS::Neutron::Pool creation

Resource OS::Neutron::Pool could not be created when
cookie_name param for session_persistence is not set.

By default params that is not set filled with None
as value and passed to the client. This is incorrent
behaviour in Neutron case. Neutron require that all
fields that is not set should not be passed at all.

So we need to fillter out cookie_name param if it's
value set to None.

Closes-bug: #1270750
Change-Id: Iafb082f69bf1dd7a4f49151f65d5a1b8c69f1337

commit_message:
Removes use of timeutils.set_time_override

The set_time_override function in timeutils was written as a
helper function to mock utcnow for unittests before 'mock' was
generally used. Now that we have mock and fixture, we no longer
need to use it.

Change-Id: I7c3793d7a442dc85aec405041c3c9ce6f7503bd8
Closes-Bug: #1266962

commit_message:
Fix 'search_opts' unexpected keyword argument error

When executing 'encryption-type-create' command using resource
name, it will use the findall() in base.py, then error will
occur because list() in findall() used 'search_opts' argument
which list() in VolumeEncryptionTypeManager did not have. Some
other command like 'transfer-delete' met same issue.

This patch will add 'search_opts' argument in list() function
in child class to avoid the bug.

Closes-Bug: #1248519
Related-Bug: #1252665

Change-Id: If1cd8b812af21335e5d4351766539a927a8fbdf4

commit_message:
disable volume creation, when cinder is disabled

before this patch, it's possible to try to create a volume
from an image, create a volume during instance creation etc.

The same applies to create a volume from snapshot.

Change-Id: Ib573487938e0833668b002d05574e587734ef829
Closes-bug: 1267438

commit_message:
Remove tools from operations-guide

These tools are now provided by the
openstack-doc-tools package. Remove
to avoid confusion and ensure there is
a single point of control for the tools.

Change-Id: Ic41e0761538191d3601db07c5e445adf5398368d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/93/66993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- ''' Created on 2012-7-3 @author: daisy ''' import os, sys import tempfile import shutil import xml.dom.minidom from optparse import OptionParser import codecs from xml2po import Main from xml2po.modes.docbook import docbookXmlMode class myDocbookXmlMode(docbookXmlMode): def __init__(self): self.lists = ['itemizedlist', 'orderedlist', 'variablelist', 'segmentedlist', 'simplelist', 'calloutlist', 'varlistentry', 'userinput', 'computeroutput','prompt','command','screen'] self.objects = [ 'figure', 'textobject', 'imageobject', 'mediaobject', 'screenshot','literallayout', 'programlisting' ] default_mode = 'docbook' operation = 'merge' options = { 'mark_untranslated' : False, 'expand_entities' : True, 'expand_all_entities' : False, } ignore_folder = {"docbkx-example"} root = "./doc/src/docbkx" def mergeback (folder, language): if (folder==None) : path = root else : outputFiles = mergeSingleDocument(folder, language) if ((outputFiles != None) and (len(outputFiles)>0)) : for outXML in outputFiles : changeXMLLangSetting (outXML, language) return if (not os.path.isdir(path)) : return files = os.listdir(path) for aFile in files : if (not (aFile in ignore_folder)): outputFiles = mergeSingleDocument (aFile, language) if ((outputFiles != None) and (len(outputFiles)>0)) : for outXML in outputFiles : changeXMLLangSetting (outXML, language) def mergeSingleDocument(folder, language): xmlfiles = [] outputfiles = [] abspath = os.path.join(root, folder) if (os.path.isdir(abspath)) : os.path.walk(abspath, get_xml_list, xmlfiles) else: return None if len(xmlfiles)>0 : popath = os.path.join(abspath,"locale",language+".po") #generate MO file mofile_handler, mofile_tmppath = tempfile.mkstemp() os.close(mofile_handler) os.system("msgfmt -o %s %s" % (mofile_tmppath, popath)) for aXML in xmlfiles : #(filename, ext) = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(aXML)) relpath = os.path.relpath(aXML, root) outputpath = os.path.join(os.path.curdir, "generated", language, relpath) try: xml2po_main = Main(default_mode, operation, outputpath, options) xml2po_main.current_mode = myDocbookXmlMode() xml2po_main.merge(mofile_tmppath, aXML) outputfiles.append(outputpath) except IOError: print "Error: cannot open aFile %s for writing." sys.exit(5) except : print ("Exception happen") if mofile_tmppath : os.remove(mofile_tmppath) return outputfiles def changeXMLLangSetting(xmlFile, language): dom = xml.dom.minidom.parse(xmlFile) root = dom.documentElement root.setAttribute("xml:lang", language[:2]) fileObj = codecs.open(xmlFile, "wb", encoding="utf-8") #add namespace to link nodelists = root.getElementsByTagName("link") for node in nodelists : if (node.hasAttribute("href")) : node.setAttribute("xlink:href", node.getAttribute("href")) if (node.hasAttribute("title")) : node.setAttribute("xlink:title", node.getAttribute("title")) dom.writexml(fileObj) def get_xml_list (sms, dr, flst): if ((flst == "target") or (flst == "wadls")) : return if (dr.find("target")>-1) : return if (dr.find("wadls")>-1) : return for f in flst: if ((f.endswith(".xml") and (f != "pom.xml"))) : sms.append(os.path.join(dr,f)) def main(argv): usage = "usage: %prog [options] command [cmd_options]" description = "This is the tool to generate translated docbooks, which"\ " will be stored in 'generated/[language]/" parser = OptionParser( usage=usage, version="0.6", description=description ) parser.disable_interspersed_args() parser.add_option( "-l", "--language", dest="language", help=("specified language") ) parser.add_option( "-b", "--book", dest="book", help=("specified docbook") ) (options, args) = parser.parse_args() if (options.language == None) : print "must specify language" return #change working directory #copy folders folder = options.book language = options.language sourcepath = os.path.join(root, folder) destpath = os.path.join(os.path.curdir, "generated", language) if (not os.path.exists(destpath)) : os.makedirs(destpath) destfolder = os.path.join(destpath, folder) if (os.path.exists(destfolder)) : shutil.rmtree(destfolder) os.system("cp -r %s %s" % (sourcepath, destpath)) mergeback(folder, language) if __name__ == '__main__': main(sys.argv[1:])

commit_message:
Do not use node argument in drivers

Task object which is passed to drivers methods already
contains a node object. In order to get rid of unnecessary
node attribute, the drivers should not use it.

This patch does not remove node attribute from methods in order to
maintain compatibility with the other code.

Partial-bug: #1259346
Change-Id: I9229932628a3006b52eacb99e68cf1c28fcfa22c

commit_message:
Add attribute to support upgrade

Add node["openstack"]["action"] attribute in Chef environment to
support OpenStack deployment installed by previous version of
cookbooks upgrade to current cookbooks version.

Change-Id: I2bc49f2e6bac3d9425c0a4c51ff2771b673dd54e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-repo refs/changes/63/67363/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default_attributes( "openstack" => { # The value of action can be "install" or "upgrade". # "install" means to install OpenStack using current cookbooks. # "upgrade" means to upgrade the current OpenStack deployment # installed by previous version of cookbooks to current cookbooks version. # The upgrade action upgrade OpenStack packages and databases. "action" => "install" } )

commit_message:
Use migration tests from common Oslo code

Common database code from Oslo contains base class for database
migrations so we can re-use it in Glance.

Reused similar glance code, removed common migration test cases - common
code already tested.

blueprint db-use-oslo-common-code

Change-Id: I12b259cb7587f49a4032b33c7dbfafef58128ff4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/43/65643/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = GLANCE_LOCK_PATH=${GLANCE_LOCK_PATH:-'/tmp/'} nosetests {posargs}

commit_message:
remove oslo.messaging -f urls

these don't play right with pip 1.5, we have to give up doing
pre-release in this way. If we want pre-release code it should
be integrated as part of the gate and use /opt/stack.

Otherwise, we should just release oslo libraries more often, and
not wait for release boundaries.

Change-Id: I778d757b69286ad8ba1b99a4c0a230b78eb4241a

commit_message:
Use timeutil.total_seconds in api

timeutils.total_seconds can work in Pythin 2.6 and later version.
we don't need caculate total seconds of datetime.timedelta object
manually. This patch also fixes wrong conversion between second
and microseconds.One second equals 10 ** 6 microseconds.

Change-Id: I619f612ec4fefb9972caa239c1b8a0c56e3dff9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/64942/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: seconds = timeutils.total_seconds(dt) info['uptime'] = timeutils.total_seconds(delta)
deleted_lines: seconds = (dt.days * 3600 * 24 + dt.seconds + dt.microseconds / 100000.0) info['uptime'] = delta.days * 24 * 3600 + delta.seconds

commit_message:
service-create allows 2 services with same name

Two service must not share the same name
To avoid that the name is estracted from the extra
column in the DB to a new column named name which is unique.

Closes-Bug: #1259425
Change-Id: I770dadd38d901e68760dd82ea0e1929293fcf062

subject: make ext_bridge_iface optional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-06 13:18:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network/commit/c4b5be0f6fca978beba52a14a5cd6d3d268836d6', 'message': 'make ext_bridge_iface optional

In some scenarios, the user might not have a second interface to
properly use the l3-agent, but still wants to use the cookbook.

This change breaks the ovs-vsctl calls in two executes, one for adding
the bridge (with a slightly altered `not_if`) and one for the actual
`add-port` call (allowing to be disabled by setting the
`external_network_bridge_interface` to `nil`).

Change-Id: Ic46db8b4f00aafa1ee3591ef748a2d154aff9115
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-06 13:45:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network/commit/ce4e900a4bb7580f8ec339377c2dce4dec7df54c', 'message': 'make ext_bridge_iface optional

In some scenarios, the user might not have a second interface to
properly use the l3-agent, but still wants to use the cookbook.

This change breaks the ovs-vsctl calls in two executes, one for adding
the bridge (with a slightly altered `not_if`) and one for the actual
`add-port` call (allowing to be disabled by setting the
`external_network_bridge_interface` to `nil`).

The specs have been changed accordingly.

Change-Id: Ic46db8b4f00aafa1ee3591ef748a2d154aff9115
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-06 13:56:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network/commit/38a0155b6ead151d274545bc1eb8289707cb01ee', 'message': 'make ext_bridge_iface optional

In some scenarios, the user might not have a second interface to
properly use the l3-agent, but still wants to use the cookbook.

commit_message:
make ext_bridge_iface optional

In some scenarios, the user might not have a second interface to
properly use the l3-agent, but still wants the cookbook to setup the
external openvswitch bridge.

This change breaks the ovs-vsctl calls in two executes, one for creating
the bridge (with a slightly altered `not_if` if it already exists) and
one for the actual `add-port` call:

The port (with the physical interface) will not be added if:

- the interface does not exist or
- the attribute external_network_bridge_interface is empty, "", or
- the interface is already part of the external bridge.

The specs and attribute docs have been changed accordingly.  Bumped
patch number, updated CHANGELOG.md.

Change-Id: Ic46db8b4f00aafa1ee3591ef748a2d154aff9115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network refs/changes/02/60502/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command "ovs-vsctl add-br #{ext_bridge}" not_if "ovs-vsctl br-exists #{ext_bridge}'" end execute "add external interface to external network bridge" do command "ovs-vsctl add-port #{ext_bridge} #{ext_bridge_iface}" not_if "ovs-vsctl port-to-br #{ext_bridge_iface} | grep #{ext_bridge}" not_if { ext_bridge_iface.nil? }
deleted_lines: command "ovs-vsctl add-br #{ext_bridge} && ovs-vsctl add-port #{ext_bridge} #{ext_bridge_iface}" action :run not_if "ovs-vsctl show | grep 'Bridge #{ext_bridge}'"

commit_message:
Arista ML2 mech driver cleanup and integration with portbindings

fixes bug: 1215097

This patch addresses minor cleanups and integration with port binding
and dhcp support into Arista ML2 mechanism driver.

This patch was originally submitted to be included in havana-RC2, but,
was missed because of incorrect tagging on the bug. It is being
submitted again as a havana-backport-potential.
The origianl submittal was at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/49086/

Change-Id: I8e87a7b6a3b554fe2b67695f0e7c416408bf0008

commit_message:
Fix i18n messages in novaclient, part III

This change make all the text visible by the user i18n.
The changes are in prints, logs, exceptions, helps, etc
Pep8 errors about "Multiple positional placeholders" also fixed.

Change-Id: I98db9e534cd724e915db4d9ff54109437d36f18b

commit_message:
Clean up some duplicated code in mem_diskfile.DiskFile

We recently had an issue with some Swift logic in the base DiskFile that
resulted in the introduction of the new DiskFileExpired exception.

The mem_diskfile implementation didn't get updated so the bug remained there.

This change begins the work of moving the mem_diskfile implementaiton to
subclass(es) of the base diskfile implementation.  Because the
mem_diskfile.DiskFile reuses _verify_integrity the X-Delete-At logic is no
longer duplicated and the new behavior for DiskFileExpired is inherited.

Change-Id: Id10a3ab7b2188e532ca2e567f2d08bf92942b256

added_lines: def _quarantine(self, msg, data_file, **kwargs): "Expected directory, found file at %s" % self._datadir, os.path.join(self._datadir, "made-up-filename")) def _check_name_matches_hash(self, **kwargs): "Hash of name in metadata does not match directory name", **kwargs) def _get_obj_size(self, fp, **kwargs): fd = fp.fileno() try: statbuf = os.fstat(fd) except OSError as err: raise DiskFileError("not stat-able: %s" % err) return statbuf.st_size def _check_content_length_matches_obj_size(self, **kwargs): try: obj_size = self._get_obj_size(**kwargs) except DiskFileError as e: raise self._quarantine('Unable to read obj_size (%s)' % e, **kwargs) if obj_size != self._content_length: raise self._quarantine("metadata content-length %s does not " "match actual object size %s" % ( self._content_length, obj_size), **kwargs) def _verify_integrity(self, **kwargs): Verify the integrity of the object by various checks against the underlying storage. commit_message:
Don't configure on import

The keystone.config package called config.configure() at import-
time.

This will make it obvious that developers can't use config
options at import-time because packages that do that will fail on
import.

Change-Id: I9306f67609d782e3f49fd43908448daf1287d51c
Related-Bug: #1265108
Related-Bug: #1265670
Closes-Bug: #1269785
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/59/64759/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix reading cache-time before configured

There were several places where the cache time was read at
import-time. This means that the default value is used rather
than the value that the user configured because CONF() had not
been called yet.

This change makes it so the values are read at run-time, after
CONF() has been called.

Change-Id: I835418f249c5217bf79efebad1dee22d25f6774a
Closes-Bug: #1265670
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/58/64758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configure and build the cache cache.configure_cache_region(cache.REGION)
deleted_lines: # Ensure the cache is configured and built before we instantiate the managers cache.configure_cache_region(cache.REGION)

subject: adding policy checks for nova instance actions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-07 23:22:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/32f73f9326fa4bbe4c05f79d6505431a69c8c96b', 'message': 'adding policy checks for nova instance actions

Adding policy rule checks for all Nova instance actions (on both the
project and admin dashboards).

Also bringing-in some improvements to the Horizon policy engine that
were implemented by david-lyle as part of the still-pending block-rbac
work (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50773):

First, now providing the token scope project_id and user_id as targets
by default, unless otherwise specified.  Most service policy rules
check one or both of these.  Second, checking to see if rule exists,
before attempting enforcement.  If the rule does not exist, using
the default rule for that service.  This now matches what the
service policy engines do.

Change-Id: Ibf419ecf6624cf3315ddb10daee0542f7d8d2c3e
Implements: blueprint compute-rbac

commit_message:
Adding table search framework and use in admin instances

This adds table seaching on server side as a new FilterAction type.
It also implements table search by project on the instances panel in
admin dashboard as a sample use of the framework. This will help
admins when wading through the list of all instances in the cloud.

Implements: blueprint table-filtering

Change-Id: I337dccb51cbd0b1a477606ac97b17dea3295960f

commit_message:
Remove oauth2 requirement

Since this patch was merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/64427/
Keystone now uses oauthlib instead of oauth2 as it's library for
OAuth related functions.

The previous oauth2 lib can now be removed from the global
requirements

Change-Id: Iba4beddc8d6e62d1657b68740fcca9d9a8fc7351
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/22/68422/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
nova api validation fw requires jsonschema >= 2.0.0

The new nova api validation framework for v3 api uses methods (eg.
validators.extend) in jsonschema which are available starting in
version 2.0.0. The current min version is 1.3.0 and is incompatible
with the latest changes.

Change-Id: I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757
Partial-Bug: #1256344
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/64/66464/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: jsonschema>=2.0.0,<3.0.0

commit_message:
Add missing file argument to iniset_multiline

Change Id9aab356b36b2150312324a0349d120bbbbd4e63 introduced a call to
iniset_multiline to enable swift stores explicitly. However, the call
has a missing file argument which resulted in this call setting the
values to the wrong file, section and param. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Ib17048e05c467bc8ca2c13fe4297d6bac6c8a880
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/29/68629/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: iniset_multiline DEFAULT known_stores glance.store.filesystem.Store glance.store.http.Store glance.store.swift.Store

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import random import StringIO from tempest.api.compute.base import BaseV2ComputeAdminTest from tempest.common.utils.data_utils import rand_name from tempest.config import TempestConfig from tempest.exceptions import NotFound, BadRequest from tempest.test import attr import testtools from time import sleep class CeilometerAPITest(BaseV2ComputeAdminTest): _interface = 'json' @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(CeilometerAPITest, cls).setUpClass() cls.cfg = TempestConfig() if not cls.cfg.ceilometer.ceilometer_enabled: raise cls.skipException('Ceilometer is not supported.') cls.todo_metrics = [] cls.deferred_metrics = {} # Metrics requiring long wait cycle. cls.nova_metrics = ['vcpus', 'disk.ephemeral.size', 'disk.root.size', 'instance', 'memory', 'cpu', 'cpu_util', 'network.incoming.bytes', 'network.incoming.packets', 'network.outgoing.bytes', 'network.outgoing.packets'] cls.nova_longrun_metrics = ['cpu', 'cpu_util', 'network.incoming.bytes', 'network.incoming.packets', 'network.outgoing.bytes', 'network.outgoing.packets'] #TODO: implement test that uses SSH to work with VM disk. cls.nova_ssh_metrics = ['disk.read.bytes', 'disk.write.bytes', 'disk.read.requests', 'disk.write.requests'] cls.volume_create_metrics = ['volume', 'volume.size'] cls.swift_container_metrics = ['storage.objects.containers'] cls.swift_metrics = ['storage.objects', 'storage.objects.size', 'storage.objects.incoming_bytes', 'storage.objects.outgoing_bytes', 'storage.api.request'] cls.neutron_metrics_network = ['network', 'network.create', 'network.update'] cls.neutron_metrics_router = ['router', 'router.create', 'router.update'] # TODO: include 'ip.floating.update' cls.neutron_metrics_floatingip = ['ip.floating', 'ip.floating.create'] cls.neutron_metrics_subnet = ['subnet', 'subnet.create', 'subnet.update'] cls.neutron_metrics_port = ['port', 'port.create', 'port.update'] cls.neutron_metrics_longrun = ['ip.floating.create'] cls.glance_metrics = ['image', 'image.size', 'image.upload', 'image.delete', 'image.download', 'image.serve'] @attr(type="positive") @attr(type="smoke") def test_001_list_resources(self): """List all resources monitored by Ceilometer.""" resp, data = self.os.ceilometer_client.list_resources() self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '200') self.__class__.ceilometer_resources = data @attr(type="positive") def test_002_check_vm_boot_metrics(self): """Boot a VM and check that samples are added to ceilometer DB.""" resp, body = self.create_server(wait_until="ACTIVE") instance_id = body['id'] query = [('resource', 'eq', instance_id)] for metric in self.nova_metrics: if not metric in self.nova_longrun_metrics: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) else: self.__class__.deferred_metrics[metric] = instance_id self.os.servers_client.delete_server(instance_id) @testtools.skipIf(not TempestConfig().service_available.cinder, "Cinder is not available.") @attr(type='positive') def test_003_check_cinder_metrics(self): """Create a volume and check that samples are added to ceilometer DB.""" resp, body = self.os.volumes_client.\ create_volume(1, display_name=rand_name('volume')) volume_id = body['id'] query = [('resource', 'eq', volume_id)] sleep(10) # Wait for ceilometer cinder poll. for metric in self.volume_create_metrics: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) self.os.volumes_client.delete_volume(volume_id) @testtools.skipIf(not TempestConfig().service_available.swift, "Swift is not available.") @attr(type='positive') def test_004_check_swift_metrics(self): """Check if swift objects and containers are monitored.""" resp, body = self.os.container_client.create_container( rand_name('container')) container_id = body['name'] resp, body = self.os.object_client.create_object(container_id, rand_name('object'), "testdata") object_id = body['id'] query = [('resource', 'eq', object_id)] for metric in self.swift_metrics: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) query = [('resource', 'eq', container_id)] for metric in self.swift_container_metrics: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) self.os.object_client.delete_object(container_id, object_id) self.os.container_client.delete_container(container_id) @attr(type='positive') @testtools.skip("Until bug 1240741 is fixed.") def test_005_check_glance_metrics(self): """Check if glance images are monitored by Ceilometer.""" img_client = self.os.image_client_v2 resp, body = img_client.create_image(rand_name('image'), container_format='bare', disk_format='raw', visibility='public') image_file = StringIO.StringIO('*' * random.randint(1024, 4096)) image_id = body['id'] img_client.store_image(image_id, image_file) img_client.get_image_file(image_id) img_client.delete_image(image_id) query = [('resource', 'eq', image_id)] for metric in self.glance_metrics: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) @testtools.skipIf(not TempestConfig().service_available.neutron, "Neutron is not available.") @attr(type='positive') def test_006_check_neutron_metrics(self): """Check if all neutron entities are monitored by Ceilometer.""" net_client = self.os.network_client resp, body = net_client.create_network(rand_name('network')) network_id = body['network']['id'] net_client.update_network(network_id, rand_name('network')) resp, body = net_client.create_subnet(network_id, '192.168.100.0/24', 4) subnet_id = body['subnet']['id'] net_client.update_subnet(subnet_id, rand_name('subnet')) resp, body = self.os.network_client.create_port(network_id) port_id = body['port']['id'] self.os.network_client.update_port(port_id, rand_name('port')) resp, body = net_client.create_floating_ip( self.config.network.public_network_id) fip_id = body['floatingip']['id'] # TODO: find a way to get update floating ip. resp, body = net_client.create_router(rand_name('router')) router_id = body['router']['id'] net_client.update_router(router_id, name=rand_name('router')) self.os.network_client.delete_router(router_id) self.os.network_client.delete_floating_ip(fip_id) self.os.network_client.delete_port(port_id) self.os.network_client.delete_subnet(subnet_id) self.os.network_client.delete_network(network_id) query = [('resource', 'eq', fip_id)] for metric in self.neutron_metrics_floatingip: if not metric in self.neutron_metrics_longrun: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) else: self.__class__.deferred_metrics[metric] = fip_id query = [('resource', 'eq', network_id)] for metric in self.neutron_metrics_network: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) query = [('resource', 'eq', subnet_id)] for metric in self.neutron_metrics_subnet: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) query = [('resource', 'eq', port_id)] for metric in self.neutron_metrics_port: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) query = [('resource', 'eq', router_id)] for metric in self.neutron_metrics_router: resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric) @attr(type="positive") @attr(type="smoke") def test_007_list_meters(self): """Get list of all ceilometer metrics.""" resp, data = self.os.ceilometer_client.list_meters() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) @attr(type="positive") def test_008_list_alarms(self): """Check if alarms are supported.""" resp, data = self.os.ceilometer_client.list_alarms() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) @attr(type="negative") def test_009_get_nonexistent_resource(self): """Check if Not Found raised on nonexistent resource query.""" self.assertRaises(NotFound, self.os.ceilometer_client.show_resource, "Nonexistentresource") @attr(type="positive") def test_010_get_samples_nonexistent_meter(self): """Check if no exception is generated on nonexistent metric query.""" resp, data = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples('Nonexistentmeter') self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) @attr(type="negative") def test_011_get_nonexistent_alarm(self): """Check if Not found is raised on nonexistent alarm query.""" self.assertRaises(NotFound, self.os.ceilometer_client.show_alarm, "nonexistentalarm") @attr(type="positive") @testtools.skip("Not implemented.") def test_012_post_sample_existing_meter(self): """Ceck if it is possible to post a sample to existing meter.""" #TODO: Investigate sample posting technique pass @attr(type="positive") @testtools.skip("Not implemented.") def test_013_post_sample_new_meter(self): """Check if it is possible to post a new meter.""" #TODO: Invsestigate sample posting technique pass @attr(type="positive") @testtools.skip("Not implemented.") def test_014_post_arbitrary_meter(self): """Check if new meter could be posted on VM boot using metadata.""" #TODO: Investigate custom metadata format @attr(type="positive") def test_015_get_statistics(self): """Check if statistics is returned using specified format.""" result, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.get_statistics( self.nova_metrics[0]) for stat in body: for key in ["count", "duration_start", "min", "max", "duration_end", "period", "period_end", "duration", "period_start", "avg", "sum"]: self.assertTrue(key in stat.keys()) @attr(type="positive") def test_016_get_statistics_nonexistent_meter(self): """Check if statistics of nonexistent metric doesn't raise exception""" resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.get_statistics("nonexistent") self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) @attr(type="positive") def test_017_get_statistics_specify_period(self): """Check if it is possible to specify statistics period.""" resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.get_statistics( self.nova_metrics[0], 3600) self.assertEqual("200", resp['status']) @attr(type="negative") def test_018_get_statistic_invalid_query(self): """Check if invalid stat query causes Bad Request.""" query = [("nonexistentfield", "invalidoperation", "invalidvalue")] self.assertRaises(BadRequest, self.os.ceilometer_client.get_statistics, self.nova_metrics[0], 3600, query) @attr(type="positive") def test_019_get_statistic_valid_query(self): """Check if it is possible to get statistics with valid query.""" query = [("resource_id", "eq", "1")] resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.get_statistics( self.nova_metrics[0], 3600, query) self.assertEqual("200", resp['status']) @attr(type="positive") def test_020_check_deferred_metrics(self): """Wait for the Ceilometer poll and re-query polled metrics.""" sleep(3600) for metric in self.deferred_metrics.keys(): query = [('resource', 'eq', self.deferred_metrics[metric])] resp, body = self.os.ceilometer_client.show_samples(metric, query) self.assertTrue(len(body) >= 1, "Verify %s metric has a new sample." % metric)

commit_message:
Made general name validation less strict

1. Made valid_name validation much less strict
2. Changed validation type for cluster, nodegroup and templates to
   new 'valid_name_hostname' that is equal to old "valid_name" validation

Closes-Bug: #1240144

Change-Id: I3048e91f8e179aa5be510feb1c5872b40b6dc3c1

commit_message:
Add utilities for working with binary data

This utilities help to mitigate differences between Python 2 and
Python 3 when it comes to encoding and decoding binary data. They
will be widely useful across taskflow, including ZooKeeper logbook
and storage backend patches.

Initially from change I1de1525df0deee612fb14ca36f0415ea7d2f707c by
Joshua Harlow, reworked for better handling of non-ascii characters.

Change-Id: I4136fd6d7e55b716b0ba5eab838d17a77095c726
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/14/68914/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from taskflow.openstack.common import jsonutilsdef binary_encode(text, encoding='utf-8'): """Converts a string of into a binary type using given encoding. Does nothing if text not unicode string. """ if isinstance(text, six.binary_type): return text elif isinstance(text, six.text_type): return text.encode(encoding) else: raise TypeError("Expected binary or string type") def binary_decode(data, encoding='utf-8'): """Converts a binary type into a text type using given encoding. Does nothing if data is already unicode string. """ if isinstance(data, six.binary_type): return data.decode(encoding) elif isinstance(data, six.text_type): return data else: raise TypeError("Expected binary or string type") def decode_json(raw_data, root_types=(dict,)): """Parse raw data to get JSON object. Decodes a JSON from a given raw data binary and checks that the root type of that decoded object is in the allowed set of types (by default a JSON object/dict should be the root type). """ try: data = jsonutils.loads(binary_decode(raw_data)) except UnicodeDecodeError as e: raise ValueError("Expected UTF-8 decodable data: %s" % e) except ValueError as e: raise ValueError("Expected JSON decodable data: %s" % e) if root_types and not isinstance(data, tuple(root_types)): ok_types = ", ".join(str(t) for t in root_types) raise ValueError("Expected (%s) root types not: %s" % (ok_types, type(data))) return data

subject: "version" section should be required in template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-10 08:38:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/08568408746ffeb6d61ba1562ec9c98487376fab', 'message': 'Set "heat_template_version" as default for missing

"HeatTemplateFormatVersion" as default while a template missing version
section now in heat. But then the server can't parse the template in right
way, not translate hot format to cfn. Some errors raised such as:
  Error : At least one Resources member must be defined.
  but "resources" section has one resource.
  Error: The Parameter (image_id) was not defined in template.
  but "image_id" was defined in "parameter" section.

The patch will set "heat_template_version" as default for missing. There
has already translate func to convert sections from cfn to hot format in
heat.

Change-Id: Idc2ba2b9ae099d4509dfd81914aa9bb8bd3bfefb
Closes-Bug: #1267735
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-14 09:21:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/d2f250ac3f1c98812c58dc64a235e4ee199c96c2', 'message': '"version" section should be required in template

"HeatTemplateFormatVersion" as default while a template missing version
section now in heat. But then the server can't parse the template in right
way, not translate hot format to cfn. Some errors raised such as:
  Error : At least one Resources member must be defined.
  but "resources" section has one resource.
  Error: The Parameter (image_id) was not defined in template.
  but "image_id" was defined in "parameter" section.

So if we cannot determine the template version, we should raise an
exception. This patch will check whether version section is in template,
if not we should raise exception.

Change-Id: Idc2ba2b9ae099d4509dfd81914aa9bb8bd3bfefb
Closes-Bug: #1267735

section now in heat. But then the server can't parse the template in right

  Error : At least one Resources member must be defined.
  but "resources" section has one resource.
  Error: The Parameter (image_id) was not defined in template.
  but "image_id" was defined in "parameter" section.

So if we cannot determine the template version, we should raise an
exception. This patch will check whether version section is in template,
if not we should raise exception.

commit_message:
"version" section should be required in template

"HeatTemplateFormatVersion" as default while a template missing version
section now in heat. But then the server can't parse the template in right
way, not translate hot format to cfn. Some errors raised such as:
  Error : At least one Resources member must be defined.
  but "resources" section has one resource.
  Error: The Parameter (image_id) was not defined in template.
  but "image_id" was defined in "parameter" section.

So if we cannot determine the template version, we should raise an
exception. This patch will check whether version section is in template,
if not we should raise exception.

Change-Id: Idc2ba2b9ae099d4509dfd81914aa9bb8bd3bfefb
Closes-Bug: #1267735
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/95/65895/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if u'HeatTemplateFormatVersion' not in tpl: default_for_missing(tpl, u'heat_template_version',
deleted_lines: if u'heat_template_version' not in tpl: default_for_missing(tpl, u'HeatTemplateFormatVersion',

commit_message:
Fix stop_neutron metadata agent function

Currently, stop_neutron fails in Jenkins because it kills itself.
This patch ensure we kill only neutron metadata agent, and not the awk
process in itself.

Change-Id: I0f1f296b639096f08c7018cd1daebfcd9a054d01
Closes-bug: #1269982
(cherry picked from commit 04f6dc24a7845ee139977fa5b0c5e53aad8e99bd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/11/67411/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pkill -9 -f neutron-ns-metadata-proxy
deleted_lines: pid=$(ps aux | awk '/neutron-ns-metadata-proxy/ { print $2 }') [ ! -z "$pid" ] && sudo kill -9 $pid

commit_message:
Add openstack-doc-tools

openstack-doc-tools is used in the documentation and api
repositories. Latest release is 0.3.

Add it to global-requirements and add list of repositories using
it to projects.txt.

commit_message:
Allow use of oslo.messaging 1.3.0a4 from pypi

In I87eaefb37fa52142d47b4aba4f3f76452771f74e we are having beta
releases of oslo.messaging be uploaded to pypi.

We need to do this because of reported change in behaviour in pip
1.5 - from sdague:

  pip 1.5 disables non pypi urls by default, all of them will need
  to be explicitly white listed.

Change-Id: I94843886ef0b40670fb82733048113c9ef7c3c46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/40/68040/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
