commit_message:
Add documentation for GateKeeper

The purpose of GateKeeper mostly relates to the development of new swift code,
so I threw together a guide for development_middleware that covers some basics
with a eye towards metadata handling in-particular.

I also fixed up some missing autodoc's, split out middleware autodoc and added
some ref's here and about so I could link to them from the
development_middleware guide.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I20dd942ea8df9e33c3e794cb49669ffa1332c63e

Static Large Objects ==================== .. automodule:: swift.common.middleware.slo :members: :show-inheritance: List Endpoints ============== .. automodule:: swift.common.middleware.list_endpoints :members: :show-inheritance: Discoverability =============== Swift can optionally be configured to provide clients with an interface providing details about the installation. If configured, a GET request to /info will return configuration data in JSON format. An example response:: {"swift": {"version": "1.8.1"}, "staticweb": {}, "tempurl": {}} This would signify to the client that swift version 1.8.1 is running and that staticweb and tempurl are available in this installation. There may be administrator-only information available via /info. To retrieve it, one must use an HMAC-signed request, similar to TempURL. The signature may be produced like so: swift-temp-url GET 3600 /info secret 2>/dev/null | sed s/temp_url/swiftinfo/g

commit_message:
remove the nova v3 xml tests from the code

this is phase 2 in removing the xml tests from the code, should
give us an idea on the run time differences now that testr will
pull these out of the scheduler.

Part of bp:remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: I0fbb19b6d0b6dbbcb9c9c9e0cb86690abc4790a0

commit_message:
Move additional log artifacts into logs dir

* functions.sh(cleanup_host): Collect additional log artifacts into
the logs directory so we'll be able to simplify the devstack-logs
publisher.

Change-Id: I47227ed28b60927d528fdf220c981cf5d8515c88

commit_message:
libvirt: Removes unused argument suffix in _create_image

The private method _create_image has an optional argument
not used. This patchset remove it and corrects tests.

Change-Id: Id1bd1b42989bc43dd7a312aacc3add040410ec2d

subject: Revert "Add package install support to openstack-clients"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-24 17:38:25.000000000', 'files': ['elements/openstack-clients/install.d/openstack-clients-package-install/51-openstack-clients', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/51-openstack-clients'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/0f3f64d0fd8de9165862b43da7e5ca458ec3a7f7', 'message': 'Revert "Add package install support to openstack-clients"

There was a problem with this commit that causes a regression, I added
a +A when I intended to -1. This needs to be reverted in order to allow
time to fix. Essentially the clients arn't getting installed on the
images because the reponame varies for each client library and
source-repositories does not support this.

This reverts commit 74438c32e0f8c29600aa57656555c88e69106afd.

Change-Id: Id24426027b3043538e41b4bddbe45750d78dbfb6
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add package install support to openstack-clients"

There was a problem with this commit that causes a regression, I added
a +A when I intended to -1. This needs to be reverted in order to allow
time to fix. Essentially the clients arn't getting installed on the
images because the reponame varies for each client library and
source-repositories does not support this.

This reverts commit 74438c32e0f8c29600aa57656555c88e69106afd.

Change-Id: Id24426027b3043538e41b4bddbe45750d78dbfb6

added_lines: # Copyright 2013: Mirantis Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from rally.deploy.engines import fuel from rally import test import json class FuelNodeTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_check(self): n = fuel.FuelNode(json.load(open('/tmp/nodes.json', 'r'))) self.assertFalse(n.check('ram==1024')) self.assertFalse(n.check('ram!=2147483648')) self.assertFalse(n.check('ram<=2147483647')) self.assertFalse(n.check('ram>=2147483649')) self.assertFalse(n.check('ram<1024')) self.assertFalse(n.check('ram>102400000000')) self.assertTrue(n.check('ram==2147483648')) self.assertTrue(n.check('ram!=2147483647')) self.assertTrue(n.check('ram<=2147483649')) self.assertTrue(n.check('ram>=2147483647')) self.assertTrue(n.check('ram<102400000000')) self.assertTrue(n.check('ram>1024')) self.assertTrue(n.check('mac==52:54:00:83:07:10')) self.assertTrue(n.check('mac!=52:54:00:83:07:11')) self.assertTrue(n.check('storage==17179869184')) self.assertTrue(n.check('storage>=1G')) self.assertTrue(n.check('storage<2T')) self.assertFalse(n.check('storage>2T')) class FuelClientTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_fuel(self): return c = fuel.FuelClient('http://10.20.0.2:8000/api/v1/') for i in c.list_nodes(): print json.dumps(i, indent=4)

commit_message:
Add option to use deployment on creation

Call use deployment when a deployment is created so that the newly
created deployment is default for future operations.

Change-Id: I3d223336d221f4794b3912fea8a381a0c4934aa5

commit_message:
Create rally deployment from OS_* environment variables

This saves users from creating dummy config json files when they already
have an openrc for use with the other openstack clients.

Change-Id: I487af60e0c6a5eadfc12f04fbba9c4a4186740e0
